text: Caïn venant de tuer son frère Abel Henri Vidal (born May 4, 1864 in Charenton, died in 1918 in Le Cannet) was a French sculptor known for his sculpture, Caïn venant de tuer son frère Abel (Cain, after having murdered his brother Abel) which is in the Tuileries Garden in Paris. Vidal was a student of Mathurin Moreau. ==Honours and awards== At the he was awarded *In 1884, an honorable mention; *In 1890, a medal in the 3rd class; *In 1892, the Salon prize awarded by the Superior Council of Fine Arts; *In 1892, a medal in the 2nd class and *In 1900, a medal in the 1st class. At the 1900 Paris Exposition he won a silver medal. ==References== * * * * * ==External links== * *Cain - Paris, France Category:1864 births Category:1918 deaths Category:19th-century French sculptors Category:20th-century French sculptors Category:French male sculptors
title: Henri Vidal (sculptor)
